intro: Acer platanoides var. bullatum, commonly known as the Japanese maple, is a deciduous tree native to Japan. It is characterized by its striking, deeply lobed leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and orange in the fall. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters and has a broad, spreading crown. Its bark is smooth and reddish-brown, becoming more fissured with age. The flowers are small and inconspicuous, appearing in clusters before the leaves in early spring.
